item.title: CO2 Emissions
item.author: michael.r.metzler@gmail.com (Michael Metzler)
item.description: Carbon Dioxide Emissions from the World Bankâ€™s World Development Index library(tidyverse) Preparing the data First we need to import the data and clean up any issues Read in the file df <- read_csv("C:/datasets/co2_global_emissions.csv") Take a look at the data I use the str function to inspect the structure of the dataframe. There are two columns for the inidicator which in this case are all the same and can be removed.

item.title: Election Fraud in North Carolina
item.author: michael.r.metzler@gmail.com (Michael Metzler)
item.description: Prep Work Load Election Data This project will be working with the precinct by precinct results of the 11/06/2018 midterm election in the state of North Carolina. These results were obtained from the North Carolina State Board of Elections & Ethics Enforcement website on 11/30/2018 at the following URL: https://dl.ncsbe.gov/ENRS/2018_11_06/results_pct_20181106.zip nc_results <- read_delim( "C:/datasets/results_pct_20181106.txt", "\t", escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE ) names(nc_results) <- names(nc_results) %>% tolower() %>% str_replace_all(" ", "_") nc_results <- nc_results %>% mutate( choice = if_else(choice == "" | is.
